website_summaries.verdict: Not just for kiddies– tweens, teens, and adults can also get in on the fun with this 4-foot deep pool.
pros: Triple-strong laminated sidewalls are reinforced with an all-around powder-coated steel band and feet
Includes: Krystal clear cartridge filter pump 1,000 gph (110V-120V), ladder, ground cloth, and debris cover
Convenient drain plug connects to a garden hose

customer_reviews.title: No longer affortable due to covid price gouging
customer_reviews.text: Great pool and used to be affortable, but Amazon is allowing price gouging due to the carona virus and now this pool costs 10 times or more what it did pre covid. Amazon should be ashamed of themselves for allowing this during such awful times.
customer_reviews.author: spoogey

customer_reviews.title: A SMALL PRICE AND A BIG HIT!
customer_reviews.text: Not bad at all for the price. We opted to cut (12) 2x4s and make a level base. Each was cut at 37 3/4 inches (outside) and miter cuts of 15 degrees. We invested in $25 worth of playground sand for under the liner.
customer_reviews.author: Triagenurse

customer_reviews.title: Best $100 i ever spent!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Intex pool! We had our first one for 6 years, and then the metal poles finally rusted, so we bought a new one. I think you can buy new poles, so we'll do that next time, the liner was in perfect shape. My dogs jump in and out of this thing all day, and if it can withstand that, it can withstand anything! For $100, you can't get any better than this!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn E. Scholes

customer_reviews.title: Pandemic Price Gouging!!!
customer_reviews.text: Don't get me wrong, this is a fine little pool, BUT, I paid $99 for mine 2 years ago!!!!! I see it listed now for 8x that amount, please unless you are rich or absolutely desperate for this product do not pay that much, it's not worth it! The max price this pool should sell for is $200, that's being generous. It is simply not worth the current asking price, ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: what a waste of time and
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pool in Feb.. First this is not my first Intex. . Had a smaller pool 6 yrs ago and no problems. This one has been nothing but a hassle. I am now draining it after primary few inches of water. I had already repaired a few small holes. There is a major leak now. It is coming down, what a waste of time and money
customer_reviews.author: Jeickhoff

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Amazing value for the money, kids love it. We've set it up and moved it once and had no issues setting it up, taking it down and setting it back up again. We first used it at our cabin in the mountains and then at home. Ground needs to be nice and level otherwise you'll have issues with the frame. The pump started to shut on and off randomly after a couple weeks but it was under warranty and was replaced without hassle. I didn't expect to get much of a pump considering the cost of the entire setup so that would be a worthy aftermarket upgrade if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan S.

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but not worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: Pump that comes with this pool is a joke to say the least. Ended getting a sand filter pump and it works much better Sturdiness?? Well, barely a year in and it already is tearing at the seams, and no matter how I patch it, it still leaks I paid $259 for this, now they’re over $1500?! Wow, this whole pandemic has really taken its toll I guess I don’t recommend this pool, even for the $259 it is normally priced at. Look elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: Raffi K.

customer_reviews.title: Its ok
customer_reviews.text: It was not easy it took more than 5 hours to put up because the pegs kept popping back out after they were snapped into place. It is way bigger and deeper than i expected but good for the price. It seems pretty durable but i recommend not using those flimsy plastic snaps they give you it really need good sturdy bolts and nuts to hold it securely in place. My main worry is the stray cats around here scratching holes in it which is why i didnt get the inflatable one it seems thick enough to endure we'll see
customer_reviews.author: DeQui

customer_reviews.title: Gets holes easy! Cheap liner, very thin
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased two of these pools, each one has gotten holes in the bottom. To replace just the liner with shipping is almost 70$.. when you can the pool for alittle over 100$... so no point there. This is a pool your going to throw away every year even if you spend days and extra money, Digging and leveling it off and putting sand down. The liner is very thin. So if your cool with spending the money and throwing it away after the season is over then this is good but if you want a pool to keep to put up each year this won’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Good pool...just wait for better pricing.
customer_reviews.text: Decent pool for a great price when we bought it...only $99 with free shipping. We’re on the third year since purchasing, and it is springing a few minor leaks due to the liner aging. I just put a piece of flex tape over it, and it seems to seal it up. I imagine this may be our last year. I was just looking to purchase another one, but the ridiculous pricing has turned me away.... $600-$800 now!
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: This pool exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: I've owned it for 5 years, purchased it in 2015 for under a hundred dollars including the pump and everything. The pump has finally failed, but after 5 years I'm not complaining. They have increased astronomically in value to absurd prices today. I wish I had purchased many of these for resale now because they're great.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: the pool is fine...
customer_reviews.text: Its the filter Ppump and ladder that came with that are garbage. The filter pump is not strong enough for the amount of water it is cleaning. Last summer I ended up changing the filter every few days or the water pressure would dissipate to almost nothing. This year I have the option to spend a fortune on filters or spend a fortune on a larger filter pump. The ladder is just cheep and flimsy. You would think for the height they would include a ladder that has a small platform for its top step. I tried emailing Intex but never heard a word back.
customer_reviews.author: The Shrike

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the seller.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased (seller: VM EXPRESS) a 15’x48” intex metal above ground pool on Feb. 20, 2020 because the price was $379.79. Because we live in Washington state, and it is still winter in February and March we set up our pool on April 20, 2020. ( two months later because the weather was improving). Once set up, We noticed that the liner was leaking. Contacted VM EXPRESS (3 times) and was told that they could not help us with the issue because it was past their 30 day policy. Contacted the manufacturer , Intex 3 times, no response. So now we are stuck with a large pool and a liner that leaks. Totally disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: MISPREPRESENTED
customer_reviews.text: This product was completely misrepresented on the website. The pool arrived in a ripped box with eBay tape all over it. Website clearly states pool come with ground cloth, filter pump, debris cover and removable ladder... NONE of the items were included. Pool was supposed to be INTEX brand and it was actually BESTWAY brand. I paid over $1500.00 for this pool and the pool I received retails at Home Depot for less than $400. I buy a tremendous amount of items from Amazon every year. This was a terrible experience and with this level of disregard for quality control, I question whether purchasing things from Amazon is even a good idea anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Kathrine hodge

customer_reviews.title: Filter stopped working 3 weeks in and water turned green
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited about this at first. Told everyone about it - it seemed like a great deal. About two weeks in the filter started acting up. My husband spent a lot of time trying to fix it. We had one hot week and it seemed to barely be working. Overnight the water turned completely green. It smelled terrible and we had to empty the pool and try to clean the lining. We’re past the 30 day purchase period, so we’ll have to reach out to Intex about buying a bigger pump that will probably cost more than the pool did. Super bummed we didn’t get half a summer out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Delgado5104

customer_reviews.title: Large Tear in Pool Liner
customer_reviews.text: I have had intex products in the past and not had problems. I took the pieces out of the box for this pool, and without even unfolding the pool liner, could see a fairly big tear in the liner. The plastic it had been wrapped in did not have a tear, so assuming it did not happen during shipping. A total pain to return an item that I cannot even lift! But it is going back, and a new one is on the way and hopefully I can come back and give 5 stars. CHECK LINER ONCE REMOVED FROM BOX!
customer_reviews.author: labellevie412

customer_reviews.title: Happy until it started leaking
customer_reviews.text: It was pretty easy to put together. Looks nice. We got the 12'x30" and it was a nice size for small kids. I do wish we would've gotten a little bigger. We've had it for just over a month and just noticed it leaking water somewhere out the bottom. and it just so happens that we're past the 30 day return mark, so I guess we're just screwed 😔
customer_reviews.author: MomOf2

customer_reviews.title: Keeps your cool in shallow water
customer_reviews.text: I forgot that 30 inches is not that deep. It worked out great for my dogs, to feel like I was on an oasis paradise island, I needed a pool float and an alcoholic beverage! It’s large enough to have a float or two and to keep your cool during the summer months. I did however have it on uneven ground above a tree root so need to be careful where I step occasionally. There was a small rock that damaged the liner and I had to patch it several times (it grew). Glue does not come with the packaging so you have to buy it on your own. For the money, not a bad idea.
customer_reviews.author: alfe

customer_reviews.title: Like the pool not the jacked up covd price
customer_reviews.text: I set it up by myself and it was somewhat easy. hardest part leveling spot. don't build on any kind of slope, one you will not be able to fill pool to max and or it could bust. Times like this I am glad i own tractor with loader. made getting spot ready easier. may have spent too much till i seen my grand baby enjoying it for hours at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Everyone needs Entertainment
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pool like this I bought. I didn’t really need the whole pool. I just needed to replace a few legs and the cover. But when it priced out it was cheaper just to buy a whole new pool. So most of it is under my bed which makes for a great conversation with your family when they ask what is under your bed and you just look straight at them and say a “swimming pool, what else would I keep under my bed?” For some reason though my family is starting to question my sanity. I can however say I probably do things to purposely make them think I’m a little off.
customer_reviews.author: fairchild

customer_reviews.title: still perfect. Kids love it
customer_reviews.text: We bought this pool last year from warehouse deals. Had it up and running as a chlorine pool last year for approximately 7 months, took it down, let it dry/cleaned it, stored it in a commercial tote until this season (just got it up and going at the end of may). still perfect. Kids love it. This year we bought the intex saltwater system and upgraded to the 1500GPH pump (from the 1000GPH that we upgraded last season--pool comes with a 750 gph i believe). We also bought the Pool canopy, Ladder with platform, pool cover/tarp (in 15ft to give extra room) This thing is the best investment for a fun summer. Even adults have enjoyed ours!
customer_reviews.author: JenniferC

customer_reviews.title: Overall hate it.
customer_reviews.text: Took 2 days after prime delivery day, box is heavy had to use hand cart. Will install and update as we go. Update. Leaks from somewhere water around bottom edge. Update loose drain fixed. Also filter leaks on very poorly designed and cheap filter hoses. I fix filter still leaks all day/filter. Ladder is VERY shaky and hard to use for 240lb man. Pins have popped up on some brackets. Probably taking down and getting rid of it. Not possible to have straight legs one whole side look crooked even though I used a level. Instructions suck. Update 2 months still leaks from filter gallon a day. Plastic pins pop up frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Oldham

customer_reviews.title: Intex is getting cheap.
customer_reviews.text: I have had about 5 different Intex pools and they are getting cheaper & cheaper built. They know the filters they sell with them will no where come close to doing the job. So I have the larger filter set up but this pool has the cheap connections to where it is a pain to convert it to there brand name of upgrade filter pump. Just cheaper & cheaper. Too bad.
customer_reviews.author: sherri

customer_reviews.title: Decent pool for the price
customer_reviews.text: It was not hard to install, but it does take at least 2 people to set it up. I have 2 issues with this pool - first, the pump/filter is cheap and works okay, but you really need a sand filter to get the job done right. Second, the attachments for the hoses to the pool did not last very long. They actually just slid right off after a few months and suddenly water was squirting right out the side of my pool!! These are not moving parts - they are completely stationary - so they should be longer lasting and sturdier, but somehow they no longer fit and they created a large problem!
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pool
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! We have 3 large teens, an 11 years old, and my husband and I, and we ALL fit very comfortably in this pool. We don't just sit around, we play games and we are moving constantly. A little pricey, however. If we need a pool, (like this time around), we choose Intex. They last. We had one but we moved so we gave it away. That was an excellent condition and we had it for 4 summers.
customer_reviews.author: 4 konijnen

customer_reviews.title: Great pool
customer_reviews.text: This is been a great pool we’ve had it up for about a month. We did buy a separate filter because the filter on these pools are that great and you have to change very frequently. We have had a lot of fun so far this summer doesn’t take that long to put together a few hours or so with help. The only bad thing was that the company that shipped this pool for some reason took longer than expected so it took almost 2 weeks to get my pool but other than that I would say everything is great
customer_reviews.author: christina

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for our family of 5...plus friends!
customer_reviews.text: Last year we had a 30” pool. Our 3 boys (ages 6,8 and 10) were only waist deep and couldn’t do much swimming, so we went bigger this year. Are not disappointed! The pool is 48” tall, but since the water doesn’t come all the way to the top, they can all still stand flat footed with their heads above the water. My husband put a piece of old carpet underneath and it is so much softer on our feet. No rocks poking through.
customer_reviews.author: laura fagan

customer_reviews.title: It's used!
customer_reviews.text: I did not realize I was getting a used pool. It was a good buy, and I did not see where it said it was used. It had 3 leaks. 2 of them I have repaired, and the other is in bottom of pool. I need to empty and then repair it, but have used the pool, and do not want to let it become empty, so keep adding water. I have arthritis and fibromyalgia and exercising in water seems to help. I discovered there is another leak today. I have repaired all leaks, but this one. I just thought the one I fixed yesterday, was the last one. NO, there were two. I have yet to find this one.
customer_reviews.author: jeese

customer_reviews.title: Great Pool, Poor pump.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pool as an Easter present for my kids. I have a 5, 9, and 12 year old and this is the perfect size for everyone to be able to enjoy themselves. Only downfall, as others mentioned, is the pump. I do suppose that it’s better than nothing though, which is why I decided to spend more to get the pool with the pump. Although I don’t expect the pool to last for years, it’s going to be put to great use during the hot Texas Summers.
customer_reviews.author: Erin N.

customer_reviews.title: Great pool!
customer_reviews.text: The pandemic price-gauging is unfortunate, but the pool is fantastic! It took a very long time to get here due to a delivery issue, but once here, set up was easy. The pump is working fine but the filter needs to be cleaned every 1-2 days. For other new pool owners, this pool requires the same maintenance as an inground pool if you want to keep the water nice, so take time to do some research before you commit. That said, it is saving our summer!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Defective pool
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the 15' x 48" pool May 2020 and were excited to put it together. Unfortunately, the pool came with the wrong horizontal beams. The beams that came with the pool are Intex part number 12146 which are about 2 1/2 inches shorter than the horizontal beams that are supposed to come with the pool. As a result, the pool frame is unstable and collapses in upon itself. Intex and the seller (My Quick Buy) have been completely unhelpful. We have identified the problem and asked for replacement parts but with no response from either party. We're waiting on Amazon to investigate our refund claim.
customer_reviews.author: jbm

customer_reviews.title: Defective pump
customer_reviews.text: Pump quit a month into use. Of course it happened a week after the 30 day return window so the seller wouldn't help at all. I found a cheap puump that might work for $50 but it looks like I'm going to have to spend at least $100. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: nursemc

customer_reviews.title: Save your money!
customer_reviews.text: I submitted to Amazon to return this pool shortly after buying it as I saw some poor reviews just after the purchase. UPS never showed up to pick it up so I just went ahead and set it up last week. The pump has already stopped working! My poor son! He was so looking forward to have friends and cousins to come swimming with him and now it is doing nothing more than being an oversized birdbath in our yard!
customer_reviews.author: candi

customer_reviews.title: If you intend to cover the pool from rain and wind... don’t get this
customer_reviews.text: The cover is super small and super heavy... doesn’t reach to wrap around. I had to buy extra strength clutches to hold the ends and it still didn’t reach all around. Mind you, we tried putting it on with 3 people. If I hadn’t waited til past the return date to open the darn thing... (covid precautions) I would’ve returned it... also, the material is sewed wrong, it’s not supposed to twist this way.... super pissed about this! Didn’t come cheap either. I highly don’t recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Areg Shahbazian

customer_reviews.title: Ineffective, leaky filter; incomplete assembly directions; unhelpful product support
customer_reviews.text: The filter has absolutely NO suction power and the filter unit leaked constantly, so it was continuously siphoning off pool water, even when the filter was turned off. Multiple calls to product support failed to offer any suggestions for improvement, so I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: Great pool, buy another pump.
customer_reviews.text: PROS: Super easy set up! Sturdy! The perfect addition to our summer and we take it down and store it for winter. CONS: The pump this pool (and other intex and similar pools come with) is a joke. Buy a good sand filter, it’s worth the money and your pool will stay crystal clear. Some chlorine, a cheap rechargeable pool vacuum and a good sand pump is ALL you need. We threw out the included intex pump.
customer_reviews.author: Mrsanav

customer_reviews.title: Nice big size and easy to assemble and take down after the season ends.
customer_reviews.text: You can set this thing up in less than ten minutes if you've got a helping hand and your ground is level and free of debris. The filter that comes with it isn't really powerful enough to do a great job in my opinion, but the pool is a good size and is the perfect size for kids between 5 and 10.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price.
customer_reviews.text: For ~$100 it is a good pool. It lasted us 2 summers with no leaks and our kids 5 and 7 loved it. My only real issue is the poles rusted at the interconnects after the first summer and it looked pretty bad at the end of the 2nd summer. We are tossing it and getting something a little bigger/deeper. I wouldnt buy it expecting it to last a long time u less you plan on sending a repainting the poles each year.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Family meeting place.
customer_reviews.text: This pool is now my family meeting place. We love it! All of the parts was there, nothing was out of place. My husband and I put it up together. The instructions was very easy to follow. My kids are enjoying it. I highly recommend INTEX. I didn't have to tweak anything. No leaks. No holes just perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Krissy

customer_reviews.title: By that I mean its a great pool for the price
customer_reviews.text: This product is what it is. By that I mean its a great pool for the price. its not going to last decades, and since the filter is small you probably will have to change the water more often that you would hope, but that is fine for a 99 dollar pool. The construction is what you would expect, and if you assemble it properly, and put it in the proper place, you will be more than pleased. just be a smart consumer, and align your expectations with the price point. Having said all that it is a fantastic product for what it is. a decent sized value item for a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Chrietzberg

customer_reviews.title: Pool Pump
customer_reviews.text: We had to buy a new sand pump for over 400 bucks to replace the one that came with the pool. The pump does not do the job. This pool should come with a better pump. I would rather pay more and get the right pump then deal with the aggravation of changing the filter 4 to 6 times a day and adding shock to the water daily still to find it mediocre clean. Horrible experience. The new sand pump works great! Plan on buying a new pump right away if you buy this pool!
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Kissell

customer_reviews.title: Leak already!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Delivered yesterday. Assembled and filled. To my surprise there is a hole in the pool. All the water leaked out over night
customer_reviews.author: MaxMarley

customer_reviews.title: Great little pool
customer_reviews.text: Great little pool ,I got a cover , skimmer and 1000gph pump to run the skimmer .the water temp. is at 90 degrees in just 2 days . I use a waterbed heater to keep it warm ,they work great been heating my pools for 6 years with the one I have .This is the biggest pool I tried to heat with it and it works .solar blanket during the day and waterbed heater at night I made a 800 gallon pool hit 101 degrees . Any who I love this pool ..
customer_reviews.author: Johnny W.

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: I'm a single mom with three kids and I was able to assemble it with some help with my neighbor. It is strong pool and the kids are having a great time. I had an issue with the pump but the seller was in communication with me daily and did not leave me till my issue was resolved. Love the pool and love PoolGuyssss (THE SELLER). Looking forward to buy more from them. Thank you for making our summer great during the pandemic time.
customer_reviews.author: Dahlia Mikhail

customer_reviews.title: Perfect small pool
customer_reviews.text: I love this little pool. The pump & filter have been flawless, my water is crystal clear - after I figured out pool chemicals. The kids love this (8-13). I expect I will get a bigger pool next year. I paid way more for this than is sensible - because I bought it during the high-demand period during Covid-19, when many wanted a pool as they stay home.
customer_reviews.author: Express

customer_reviews.title: Simple and wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Loving this pool. Fairly easy set up, fabulous size and zero leaks, rips or tears as some have reviewed. Mine didn’t come with instructions but I found them online. I didn’t use the filter that came with it so I haven’t finished the filter set up. This pool could easily accommodate three large floats, I’ve attached a photo with two. So much easier than the 10x30 inflatable ring- easy set pool. Much less difficult to get all the wrinkles out and seemed so much easier to set up. Will try to add to review when finished with filter set up. I purchased the sand filter as frequently recommended and can’t wait to see the benefit.
customer_reviews.author: Wink

customer_reviews.title: Level level level
customer_reviews.text: Before you start, research and read all you can. This is a great pool for the money! I am very happy and the kiddos are thrilled. Setup is easy. I say read up because you must have a good level base to maximize the longevity. I put it up thinking I was level, I was wrong. Had to level ground. After that it has been simple. Save your self the heartache of the cartridge filters and buy a sand filter. It keep this thing so clear. I also bought a salt chlorination system. Pretty simple and easy to maintain now. Water is clear and perfect balance in chemicals. Here’s pics of my setup.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Lasted the summer and ready for next.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say but for the price it gave my family and I hours and hours of fun all summer long. Next year it will be used all over again and is still in great shape. Ensure you put the pool on smooth ground, sweep before hand. Slightest pebble you will feel poking through the plastic once its filled. It was strong enough no damage even with a few pebbles, just rough to walk on.
customer_reviews.author: steven d eymann

customer_reviews.title: I am not happy at all
customer_reviews.text: My pump quit and it hasn't even been thirty days. I called the customer service line several times and went to different options and it keeps hanging up on me. I have brand new pool now without a pump. I am not happy at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Such a Fantastic Pool
customer_reviews.text: My three and seven year old have had an absolute blast this summer thanks to this pool. It’s the perfect size for young children learning to swim, and even is sufficient enough for myself. It comes to about the top of my thigh to me, which is just enough to cool off and enjoy. It’s made very sturdy, and the pool filter works great. I remove and spray the filter every two days and I find it works best when I do so. Overall, this pool was very well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Patch

customer_reviews.title: Durable enough for 3 seasons! We love our Intex!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pool for the money! My 2 and 4 year-olds are learning to swim so much easier due to the depth. We are going on our third season. We store everything in totes and it cleans right up when we get it out of storage. What a fantastic cheap option to stay cool in the summer!
customer_reviews.author: KyleDarb

customer_reviews.title: Pool=Great!, Filter=Terrible!
customer_reviews.text: Love the pool. Easy to set up, very sturdy, and perfect for a smallish backyard. What I hate is the filter! The included filter is inadequate for the pools size and every other day I was disconnecting and unscrewing to clean it out and get it to work. I ended up buying a filter upgrade for $102 on Amazon and our pool is now as clean as it was on day 1. If you buy this pool, be prepared to spend another 100 bucks on a better filter.
customer_reviews.author: Piper Face

customer_reviews.title: I really want to like this pool
customer_reviews.text: I really want to like this pool! It was easy to put up and I'm in it everyday to help with back pain, but it came with a rip (which I fixed with flextape) it's still leaking and I keep finding little holes and rips, I don't want to send it back cause I paid $97 and I don't think I can put this thing back in it's box to ship it back.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Best summer entertainment purchase in years
customer_reviews.text: It was so easy to put together. My 14yr old daughter and I did it in an hour. With no prior experience. It took us forever to fill it up lol but our water pressure sucks. Two months and very rowdy teenagers later and it's still something I'm proud I bought. I even found a way to do my physical therapy in it and skip the expensive doctors
customer_reviews.author: CreativeMommies

customer_reviews.title: Good Pool
customer_reviews.text: The pool was not hard to put together and the kids enjoyed it for 2 years with no damages. After 2 years we got a small hole and then a few other so we just ended up throwing it away. we bought this pool march of 2018 and the pool was $100 dollars and now its at over $550?!?!?! RIIIPPPP OOOFFFFFF!!!!!!!!! i would not pay that much for this pool.
customer_reviews.author: Carolina

customer_reviews.title: Best $100 ever spent on something to do this summer
customer_reviews.text: Best $100 ever spent on something to do this summer. It took about an hour to set up because of prep time putting a tarp on the ground and making sure it was all smooth. Then it took about 6 to 7 hours to fill up with water. I wish there were an add on for things you'll need to go with the pool. Like chlorine, the floating chlorine dispenser, test strips, a leaf skimmer, etc. Overall it's a great pool for my little family. We have a 5 year old and 1 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Glad i bought it
customer_reviews.text: Perfect, my kids are a bit older but I didnt want something too deep that I would have to keep hawk eye on every second, my oldest is about 5 ft tall, and still had plenty of fun, sturdy played in and climbed in and out of all summer no problems. Filter works great, easy to assemble. Holds good even though it was crooked cause our whole block is a slant so it was a 3-4inch water difference on one side. Good buy was very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Sly

customer_reviews.title: Came with a slash in the bottom
customer_reviews.text: Brought this pool from my 6 year old birthday it's perfect size for her. When I finish setting up before I put water in the pool I realized it came with a big slash in the bottom of the pool. It came with patches to seal anything but I still would like an exchange. I got pics but I can't find an upload botton to show.
customer_reviews.author: AnQuaniece Moore

customer_reviews.title: What a bargain!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2 year old to swim in and I feel this is a great bargain. We only feel it up so that it reaches her waist since she's still a baby and obviously never leave children unattended. Even when shallow it can be dangerous so keep this in mind. The pool itself is great though it easily can fit a group of children and if filled all the way my nephew I would say is 4ft tall the water will reach right below his chest. This pool is great both for toddlers, young children, and even adults. I would not hesitate to purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: GreenMan

customer_reviews.title: It was not as sturdy as we hooped it would be
customer_reviews.text: It was not as sturdy as we hooped it would be. And you have to make sure it’s level! We ended up redoing ours because it was not 100% level. You need to make sure it’s level or it won’t cover the jets like it should. And I would have a water truck come out to fill the pool because it took several days to fill. And the pool is hard to stay clean, the filter isn’t that good.
customer_reviews.author: Corvinna Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Great pool for little ones, underwhelming filter pump requires constant filter cartridge replacements.
customer_reviews.text: Best summer purchase for an 8, 6, and 3 year old. -1 star because the filter pump it comes with is WAY too light-duty, and you'll find yourself replacing the filter every other day if the pool gets used on a daily basis. Otherwise, it was cake assembling the pool, and the filter if you just read the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Livid J...

customer_reviews.title: Great pool, Wish I bought Bigger
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the 15' x 48" pool. Pretty easy to set up with 2-3 people. It's harder to keep smaller pool water in good condition. Keep on top of it every day. Ditch the pump & filter that comes with it and buy a bigger sand filter pump.and all should work out well.
customer_reviews.author: Cam

customer_reviews.title: Low quality pool.
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad choice if you are looking for a pool that will last one summer, maybe two... The pump is of very low quality and does a horrible job filtering water. After one and a half summers the majority of the outer structure is breaking down with rust and the pool lining has a very noticeable discoloration. Obviously these above ground pools don’t last very long, but the quality of this particular product is disrespectful.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Great investment!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS POOL! Seriously! Steel framed. No blow up tube to be popped at the top. Thick construction. It has held up to my very rowdy 4/5 year old! It is the perfect size for a pool for him AND I can get in it, too, and actually swim around some. This is so much better than setting up the huge, labor intensive 4ftx20ft intex. Your kids will outgrow this pool before you need to replace it!
customer_reviews.author: Sherry H.

customer_reviews.title: ... it for a month and the weather finally getting nice. Leaks all over the place
customer_reviews.text: Finally put it up after having it for a month and the weather finally getting nice. Leaks all over the place. Not sure where yet, but since this was laid on top of a larger pool line bottom (very thick and no leaks) I know I didn't put any holes in it with anything on the ground. Not happy with the leaks. Hopefully I can find them and fix them. It will probably last 5 years as the last one did, so fir the money I'll deal with it.
customer_reviews.author: JohnH1051

customer_reviews.title: I was not happy about that when all I wanted was a new ...
customer_reviews.text: This had a small rip in the lining. I was told I had to pack it all back up and send back after everything was already put together. Needless to say, I was not happy about that when all I wanted was a new liner. I repaired with gorilla tape and pray it holds! Otherwise, what a waste of hate earned money.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Make sure to level your ground!
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great pool, but I wish we understood the importance of a leveled base/ground. I would assume most yards and decks aren’t level. We built a make shift sandbox so we could level the ground and keep the sand contained. We put the tarp over the sand and filled in the open areas around the pit with stones. It was a bigger project than we anticipated, but we’ll worth it. Make sure to level your ground!
customer_reviews.author: Helen 808

customer_reviews.title: Great pool for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great pool! Easy to put up and holding string so far. Advice to everyone about the filter: if you want this cheap filter to work you need to run it 24/7 and keep replacing cartridge every few days. I do that and keep it chlorinated with a bobber, shock it once a week and skim daily and my pool is beautifully clear!
customer_reviews.author: Joel Fleisher

customer_reviews.title: 😍
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this pool for about a week now. I love it. It’s a good size where at least 5 adults can sit in it very comfortable. The only thing that I disliked about this pool was how confusing the instructions for the pump are. The pump came with extra parts that are not needed at all for the setting up of the pool or pump. I did go on to YouTube to figure it out, it works great now.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Fun times
customer_reviews.text: This thing has been great. My kids have had a blast playing in it and I've even enjoyed it myself. Not deep but good enough for kids to play and jump around, have a good time. My 5 year old swims around and my 11 year old just chills in there to cool off. Made our summer a whole lot better. The set up took about 40 mins and filling with water via hose about 3/4 hrs, maybe less bc I turned it off overnight.
customer_reviews.author: JC Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble (35 minutes)
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble (35 minutes), video very helpful. Great-grandchildren love this pool we are hoping to use it again next yr and then go up in size. If all goes well will stay with Intex. We did not use the filter that came with the pool we bought an Intex Krystal Clear Sand Filter pump due to others reviews so I cannot speak to the filter that came with the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Affordable backyard paradise
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this pool. I'd had the same one for several years and when that one was accidentally shredded (don't let your big pet dogs in this pool...) I bought the new version with the updated filter and I love it even more. If you can't afford or don't want an inground pool, this is a great option.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny

customer_reviews.title: A good starter pool, especially for those with young children
customer_reviews.text: We didn't want one of the "easy setup" pools again due to how flimsy and touchy they are in regards to having to have perfectly level ground. Although this pool is much better than the "easy setup" pools, it definitely requires level ground. Our yard is anything but level, but my husband created a sort of deck for it, which greatly helped. As other reviews have stated, the cover is not included, but you definitely need to buy one. This is the perfect size for my nearly 6 year old daughter. And, for us adults, it's perfect to get in and sit down. I haven't put my float in it yet, but it would work for that as well.
customer_reviews.author: AmyA - Michigan

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used Intex pools for years. This year I had to replace my pool simply because a bad storm damaged my previous pool. Set up was easy, the product had all parts and easy to follow instructions. However I do not use the pump that comes with the pool. I find that they are not adequate for keeping the pool clean. I use the Krystal Clear Sand pump system also made by Intex. Well worth the extra money spent!! My pool stays clear all season with minimal chemicals and cleaning of debri.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Soooo worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Weve wanted an above ground pool and went ahead with this one. WAY easier to maintain than I thought. I only run the pump once or twice a week and add a dose of liquid chlorine once a week and float a 3" chlorine tablet. The photo is from 07/2019 and thats the same water since 03/2019. Only add ons purchased were the tab floater and a skimmer net. I clean it prob once a week and rinse the filter off each time before I run it. And we are in Florida!
customer_reviews.author: Savannah Sessions

customer_reviews.title: This is by far our best buy for the summer
customer_reviews.text: This is by far our best buy for the summer! We used to have a gigantic 26 x 52, it was nice, but not easy. To clean, for the little ones... i buy the 12 x 30 this summer and it was THE perfect size!!! The kids enyoged, for my toddler was perfect, and for me was the perfect deph to be able to be in the water and tanning! The maintenance was almost none (we bouth the salt filter). It is more delicate thatn the bigger ones, but for the price it worth to buy it. Im buying another next summer (the same one) but im gonna put something between the pool and the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Constanza Vargas

customer_reviews.title: Unglued bottom in less than 3 months. Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Time to return, the seller states 60 days. Mine unglued after 60 days, but not after 90 days. So , this big pool won't last more than 3 months. With 7500 gallons of water in my yard, I am extremely dissatisfied, not by the product only, but the way the seller imposed the return policy. It is a defect from the beginning. 474$ for less than 3months, I better go to public pool.
customer_reviews.author: eileen

customer_reviews.title: Pool is ok for the price. Pump is junk.
customer_reviews.text: Huge value at a small price. Kids love it. I love it. Wife loves it. Easy to clean. Update: I ended up throwing this thing in the garbage. The pool itself is decent, but the pump is junk, and a pump that will actually do anything is not cheap. It just wasn't being used enough to warrant any additional costs, and I couldn't even give it away. 3 stars because it's very inexpensive, and I always have realistic expectations based on the price I pay for something, but the pump really does just about nothing.
customer_reviews.author: richard plecenik

customer_reviews.title: GFI will fail
customer_reviews.text: Seems that the directions could be all in one manual, not throught the packaging. Supports can sink into sand as rain overflows the edges, it would be better if overflow was able to be forced away from the vertical supports. Otherwise pretty happy with it accept the GFI. They always fails within weeks of setting up these pools . Poorly designed electronics.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Easy connections.
customer_reviews.text: We set up the pool this past weekend even though the wind was blowing. I would recommend a non-windy day to set up. But we managed it anyway. We’ve used Intex plenty of times, but for some reason, this year seemed easier to connect all the pieces. Even the ladder was easier to put together. Our ground is slanted slightly so the water is a little higher on one side. But we’re okay 👌 with it.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Okay pool
customer_reviews.text: These types of pool are get what you pay for types. The instructions are not good and companies web site is even worse. They usually last 1-2 years and the under powered pumps burn out or the pool materials fall apart. But, they keep the kids cool for a few months so I guess it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Coinking1

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: My kids live this pool, great size, easy to assemble and good quality! The only part that sucked was that I waited all day for it to arrive and i got a message saying the delivery guy had some security issues when he tried to deliver but no fedex truck even came by our house. I had to end up picking it up and it was very inconvenient as well! Other than that everything was in the packet and it had zero issues like holes or bent stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Sukii Vaz

customer_reviews.title: THIS POOL IS SUCH A GOOD DEAL.
customer_reviews.text: THIS POOL IS SUCH A GOOD DEAL ......Once we had the ground level, we used 4 sheets of 8 x 4 polystyrene 1" thick insulation .... cost about $45 , much cheap and better than sand under the pool . We put the pool up in an hour or so, really easy , although no clips were provided for the filter hoses .... so check your materials .. got some from a local hardware store $5.. We are enjoying it so much ... bought intex floating pool chairs with drink holders ......simple great to relax and float around in .. EXCELLENT !
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Lane

customer_reviews.title: A small pool that stand up well
customer_reviews.text: Had this up all summer. Make sure its level. Really make sure lol. Its great at the price, not sure how amazing the filter is. But for 100 bucks what do you expect. Had a party and some teens were jumping in like lunatics and it held up great. Easy to cool off and lounge in. Needs some vacuum attachment ability. Will be cobstrucing from scratch this coming year.
customer_reviews.author: justin marquis

customer_reviews.title: JUST BUY IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: GREAT DEAL! Do not hesitate about buying this pool. This pool is sturdy and easy to set up and take down in the Fall. This is the second one I've purchased because we gave last years pool to my Brother. The only thing that isn't 5 stars is the cover. The cover doesn't stay on the pool very well, as it only has a string to tie it. We used large clamps around the top to hold the cover down...UPDATE...5/21/19 My husband bought hose clamps and put them on every other leg and the string (inside the cover) loops under them and works well, even in thunderstorms.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Leaks and dirt.
customer_reviews.text: We noticed the inside of the box was very dirty. The pool and pipes appeared to have soil on them. After putting the pool together and adding the water, it was discovered to be leaking in a couple of places. We tried patching it to no avail. I am ready to empty the pool and tossing it. The hassle of returning the stupid pool is not what I need right now.
customer_reviews.author: j kalama

customer_reviews.title: New Family ( 2 Adults + Baby)
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pool for our yard. I leveled an area and put it together with no issues. The liner is super strong too. Even though I wasn't able to remove every single rock and stone below, the liner is holding with no leaks for a few months now. The assembly was super easy (just follow directions). I will be breaking this down before winter and putting back up next summer.
customer_reviews.author: The_Frenchman

customer_reviews.title: Love this pool!
customer_reviews.text: This pool is an all-around great value. It was easy to set up, and so far has held up very sturdy. I was surprised at how roomy it really was. My husband, baby and I have been really enjoying it. Comes with the filter and pump, so all you need is some chlorine tabs, a cover, and a skimmer. Definatley a good buy for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Great, Inexpensive , Easy Set Up Pool
customer_reviews.text: We wanted an inexpensive pool that wouldn’t take days of prep and manpower to set up . This is it . It took just a few hours to prepare the ground and set up this cool looking pool ! We love it . The ladder that comes with it is better suited for kids in my opinion , though, as it has narrow steps that give the appearance of instability . We simple found a sturdier used ladder on sale and now we are swimming every chance we get .
customer_reviews.author: Mia L

customer_reviews.title: Leaked right out of box
customer_reviews.text: GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR! Pool came .. set up on a clean dry surface .. checked to make sure all is ok .. set up as instructed .. started to put water in and let it fill .. came back outside, saw about 1/3 of the water was in and was excited .. then walked around to the other side and found water slowly coming out from under the pool .. which means this brand new pool has a leak in the bottom of the liner somewhere and we can't find it!
customer_reviews.author: Julie M

customer_reviews.title: Prepare first!
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to set-up for one person. It took longer than 30 minutes, but I am sure with two people that would have been accurate. Took probably 2 hours to fill up. Honestly, ther hardest part was preparing the site to place the pool. Overall definitely worth it for my daughter and I. Just tall enough for her that she is comfortable in it (she is about 45 inches).
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Adkins

customer_reviews.title: Pump never worked
customer_reviews.text: The pool itself wasn't too hard to assemble (hardest is getting ground ready), but after all the work, we set the pool up, and the pump didn't word at all. I had to run out and buy another pump. I thought about returning entire set, but after all the work to set it up, I didn't want to break it back down and then set up another pool!
customer_reviews.author: tkg

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: This will be edited at the end of summer, but thus far we’ve had it for 3 weeks and have had absolutely no problems! It is used by 3 children and 4 adults, and we have had no issues with pump or materials. If there are any - or it does not last the summer - this review will be updated.
customer_reviews.author: D. Em

customer_reviews.title: Best thing we bought for kids and adults this su
customer_reviews.text: We have used this pool all summer long(we got it in middle May and it’s August 20th)! It’s been easy to clean, fun to swim in, big enough for five 14 yr old boys to swim/play in! We have been so happy with our pool during the Covid-19 (where most public pools are shut down) Texas summer!
customer_reviews.author: Pjmorris

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Super skeptical on buying an above ground pool let alone an above ground pool online. I ordered it with the ground cover and pool cover separate. My husband and I put this pool together and filled within 3 hours. It's a great pool. Our small dog really likes going in with us, so she jumps on the side of the pool with her nails hitting it over and over, not a single tear. We keep the filter running 24/7 and it hasn't affected our electricity bill. I definitely recommend this pool.
customer_reviews.author: Krista1325

customer_reviews.title: Pump is worthless
customer_reviews.text: The pool was easy to put together, but the pump is worthless. It is not powerful enough to circulate the water which is allowing algae to grow. We've tried to shock the pool but again because the pump will not filter and cycle the water the chemicals do not make it all the way around pool. We've only been able to use it one weekend in the month we've had it because we can't get it clean.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Maupin

customer_reviews.title: Price Gouging and Rusted in 1 year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item for $199 in 2018 and we are in 2020 it is listed for $799. This is price gouging. Item is also very bad quality. Blue color turned to white in 2 months. Poles rusted in 4 months. At the end of 6 months pool is falling apart.
customer_reviews.author: K. O

customer_reviews.title: The pool is great! The pump is worthless!
customer_reviews.text: Kids love it. The pump is kind of a pain in the butt. It doesn’t clean anything it’s more just for show. Get a couple of chlorene tablets and you’ll be fine without it. I actually plugged the filter holes and threw the filter/pump in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Came with a hole in the liner!!
customer_reviews.text: We just got done filling this brand new pool up, and there is a hole in the liner. To return this would be an absolute nightmare, I can’t even imagine. My husband is going to the store to try to find something to fix it because there’s no way we will be able to disassemble, dry, and return this. This is ridiculous. I Do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jayhawk

customer_reviews.title: Look no further, this is a great pool!
customer_reviews.text: We are on our second season and we are still happy! My girls love it. We are a family of 4 and we can all comfortably swim around without bumping into each other. Perfect for smaller children and will definitely consider Intex when sizing up when my kids get bigger. We've had no issues with our pump even being on our second season. We did break down last Fall, made sure it was completely dry and stored the liner inside. Great quality and very affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

product_meta.title: Intex 15ft x 48in Metal Frame Pool Set with Filter Pump, Ladder, Ground Cloth & Pool Cover
product_meta.description: Size:15 ft x 48 inBeat the heat all summer with the Intex metal frame pool set. Engineered for strength, this pool is supported by strong, durable steel frames which are powder coated for rust resistance & beauty. This pool will make your backyard the place to be all summer as your family can relax & play. Triple strong, super-tough laminated sidewalls are reinforced with an all-around band to keep frame legs firmly in place. Ready for water in 45 Min, - follow the instructional DVD for easy set up, & enjoy the fun! water capacity: (90%) 4, 440 gallon. Includes: Krystal clear cartridge filter pump 1, 000 GPH (110 - 120V). ladder. Ground cloth. Debris cover. Set-up & maintenance DVD. Convenient drain plug that connects to a garden hose so water can be drained away from pool or house area. New dual suction outlet fittings improve water circulation resulting in better water hygiene & clarity.
feature_bullets: Triple strong, Super-Tough laminated sidewalls are reinforced with an all-around band to keep frame legs firmly in Place
Ready for water in 45 minutes, - Follow the Instructional DVD for easy set up, and enjoy the fun! water capacity: (90%) 4, 440 gallons
Includes: Krystal clear cartridge filter pump 1, 000 GPH (110 - 120V). ladder. Ground cloth. Debris cover. 3-ply material
Set-up and maintenance DVD. Convenient drain plug that connects to a garden hose so water can be drained away from pool or house area
New dual suction outlet fittings improve water circulation resulting in better water hygiene and clarity
Do not set up the pool on sand, mud, or any soft or loose soil conditions

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars2,440 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
